trans-unit.source: Manages synchronous XML Paper Specification (XPS) serializers and type converters.
<xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsSerializationManager> manages synchronous serializers and type converters that write content to an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument>.
<xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsSerializationManagerAsync> manages asynchronous serializers and type converters that store content to an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsSerializationManager"></xref> class.
An object that provides methods for acquiring serialization readers and writers for different parts of an [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] document.
`true` to specify batch mode; otherwise, `false`.
Commits all changes and writes all buffered data.
Gets a value that indicates whether the serialization manager is in batch mode.
Batch mode is set in the `batchMode` parameter of the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsSerializationManager.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
`true` if the manager is in batch mode; otherwise, `false`.
Saves a specified [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] serialized object to the document package.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] serialized object to save.
Sets the number of pages or documents to process for font-subsetting.
The default font-subsetting `countPolicy` is 1.

`countPolicy` defines either a number of pages or documents dependent on the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.FontSubsetterCommitPolicies> enumeration value specified to the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsSerializationManager.SetFontSubsettingPolicy%2A> method.
FontSubsetterCommitPolicy
CountPolicy
Always 1 (the whole document sequence).
Number of documents.
Number of pages.
Not applicable.
The number of pages or documents to process at a time for font subsetting.
Sets the granularity at which font-subsetting is performed.
The default font-subsetting policy is <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.FontSubsetterCommitPolicies.CommitEntireSequence>.

When font glyphs for text in an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xps-md.md)] document are saved in the document package, the document text displays identically on any computer or printer.
If glyphs are not saved in document and the required font is not installed on the local computer or printer, the rendering device must substitute glyphs from another font.
Substituting glyphs can change the appearance of the text when a different font is used.
<xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsSerializationManager.SetFontSubsettingPolicy%2A> determines the granularity of font-subsetting.

<xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.FontSubsetterCommitPolicies.CommitEntireSequence> (default) is the most efficient and enables the pages of all documents in a document sequence to share one font-subset that contains only the glyphs that are actually used.
When creating interleaved documents, font-subsetting across a document sequence can require a large amount of memory to hold the complete document until the final font-subset can be determined.

<xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.FontSubsetterCommitPolicies.CommitPerPage> or <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.FontSubsetterCommitPolicies.CommitPerDocument> can be specified to reduce application memory requirements when you create interleaved documents.

When `policy` is <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.FontSubsetterCommitPolicies.None>, all the glyphs for all fonts that are used in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xps-md.md)] document are saved, even glyphs for characters that not actually used in the text.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the font-subsetting policy.
Occurs when an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xps-md.md)] serializer requests a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref>.
For more information about event handlers, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Occurs when a page or document finishes serialization.
For more information about event handlers, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
